title: [ad] Tecrubeli handwritten flyer
content:
Found this wonderful “tecrübeli” (experienced) flyer in my mailbox today :

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706174522im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/tecrubeli_ad_3729.gif)

 [‹ What is the font in Typophile's headlings?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706174522/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44949 "Go to previous forum topic") [Italic vs. italic ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706174522/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44599 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Alessandro Segalini

comments.content: Will you explain why you like this so much? Is it just that it is hand made or is it something more?
Yes, I like the complexity of this ad and how the writer tried to solve it in his/her own way, by hand. I can have similar amusing feelings with some hand drawn note to find places.

There are some crazies in my neighborhood who make this sort of stuff and tack it up all over the place. One of them actually creates big protest signs like this about how Kissinger and the CIA conspired to kill his father. I’ll have to start scanning them one of these days.
